comments.text:
On Windows, the resize grip in the bottom-right corner of the browser window is affected when zooming the page (Ctrl+Plus/Ctrl+Minus), as if it is part of the page itself.

STR:

1. Open a new window.
2. Press Ctrl+Minus.
3. Notice that the six-dot image gets smaller.

Setting any of the border, border-width, border-style or border-color properties in CSS seems to break the default sizing grippy for textarea elements.  Removal of all of these CSS properties in Firebug brings back the original grippy and eliminates the zoom issue on this platform.
